item.title: 新加坡汽车税收入现已高得惊人，甚至超过斐济的国内生产总值
item.description: 随着新加坡驾车成本创下历史新高，该国政府从车辆配额溢价和汽车税中获得的收入比预期多出数十亿美元。【原文：The Singapore government reaped billions of dollars more in vehicle quota premiums and car taxes than it projected as the cost of driving reached record highs in the city-state.】

item.title: 石峰资本旗下Synera公司寻求8亿美元贷款用于台湾风电场项目
item.description: 知情人士透露，在台湾大力推动绿色电力供应扩容的背景下，石峰资本旗下投资组合公司Synera Renewable Energy正为其在台湾的离岸风电场项目寻求8亿美元的私募信贷。【原文：Synera Renewable Energy Co., a portfolio company of Stonepeak Partners, is seeking $800 million of private credit for its offshore wind farm project in Taiwan, according to people familiar with the matter, amid the push for green power supply expansion in the country.】

item.title: 美国环保署推翻支撑减排规则的气候立场
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普表示，其政府已撤销"危害认定"——这项具有里程碑意义的科学结论认定温室气体对人类健康和福祉构成威胁。【原文：President Donald Trump said his administration has rescinded the “endangerment finding,” a landmark scientific determination that greenhouse gases pose a threat to human health and welfare.】

item.title: 特朗普对环保署的改革将产生深远影响
item.description: 此外，中国去年的排放量有所下降。【原文：Also, China’s emissions dipped last year.】

item.title: 法国将缩减太阳能和风能计划，因电力需求放缓
item.description: 法国政府已略微缩减了扩大太阳能和陆上风电产能的计划，因该国正面临电力过剩问题——这源于摆脱化石燃料的进程慢于预期。【原文：The French government has slightly scaled back plans to expand solar and onshore wind capacity as the country grapples with a power surplus driven by a slower-than-expected shift away from fossil fuels.】

item.title: 特朗普环保署政策倒退将产生"数十年"影响
item.description:
该机构计划废除美国气候法规的核心条款，此举是激进放松监管议程的一部分，其对环境的影响将持续到总统任期结束后。【原文：

The agency’s planned repeal of a cornerstone of US climate rules is part of an aggressive deregulatory agenda whose effects on the environment will outlast the president.

】

item.title: 美国称拉尼娜现象或于四月消退
item.description: 自去年以来影响全球气候的拉尼娜现象预计将在未来数月逐渐消退，太平洋将于四月左右恢复至中性状态。【原文：The La Niña exerting its influence on global weather since last year is forecast to fizzle out in the coming months, returning the Pacific Ocean to its neutral state sometime in April.】

item.title: 美国清洁能源交易面临融资风险，因大型银行持观望态度
item.description: 摩根大通公司和摩根士丹利等领先投资银行正犹豫是否为美国可再生能源项目提供关键融资渠道。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Morgan Stanley are among leading investment banks hesitating to provide a critical source of financing for US renewables projects.】

item.title: 煤炭发电要实现美国复兴，仅靠军队还远远不够
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普正再次大力扶持日渐萎缩的美国煤炭发电产业。他将动用1.75亿美元政府资金升级六家发电厂，并要求国防部从其他发电厂购买电力。【原文：President Donald Trump is making another major bid to bolster the shrinking US coal-power industry. He’ll use $175 million in government funds to upgrade six plants and have the Defense Department buy power from others.】

item.title: 新加坡上调2030年太阳能装机目标
item.description: 新加坡提前达成既定目标后，将2030年太阳能装机目标上调50%，该城市国家正致力于在本世纪中叶实现净零排放。【原文：Singapore raised its 2030 solar installation goal by 50% after hitting its previous target early, as the city-state tries to hit net zero emissions by the middle of the century.】

item.title: 欧盟碳价暴跌，默茨暗示可能放宽规则
item.description: 欧盟碳价跌至8月以来最低水平，此前德国总理弗里德里希·默茨表示欧盟应考虑修订或推迟其碳市场计划。【原文：EU carbon prices dropped to their lowest level since August after German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the bloc should be open to revising or delaying its carbon market.】

item.title: 普利策奖获奖作曲家谈音乐如何激发气候行动
item.description:
朱莉娅·沃尔夫分享了她创作《出土》的过程——这部清唱剧探讨了全球变暖与自然生态的消亡。 

【原文：

Julia Wolfe shares how she wrote unEarth, an oratorio about global warming and nature loss. 

】

item.title: 经合组织称菲律宾必须应对财政缺口，减少税收优惠
item.description: 经济合作与发展组织指出，菲律宾必须加大力度缩减持续存在的预算赤字，并考虑削减财政激励措施，以帮助其维持经济增长势头。【原文：The Philippines must step up efforts to reduce its persistent budget deficits and consider paring back fiscal incentives to help it sustain its economic momentum, according to the Organisation for Economic Co-operation & Development.】

item.title: 中国去年碳排放量出现下降，为2022年以来首次
item.description: 2025年中国二氧化碳排放量下降0.3%，这是自2022年新冠疫情限制措施实施以来首次出现年度下降——更重要的是，这一减排成果是在能源需求增长依然强劲的背景下取得的。【原文：China’s carbon dioxide emissions fell 0.3% in 2025, the first annual decline since Covid-era restrictions in 2022 — and more importantly, a reduction that’s happened even as energy demand growth remains strong.】

item.title: 特朗普下令五角大楼采购煤炭电力以提振该行业
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普总统采取多项举措延长美国对煤炭发电的依赖，他下令五角大楼从发电厂购买电力，并宣布投入数百万美元升级现有设施。【原文：President Donald Trump moved on several fronts to prolong US reliance on coal power, as he ordered the Pentagon to purchase electricity from plants and announced millions of dollars to upgrade existing facilities.】

item.title: 默茨称欧盟应考虑调整碳市场机制
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希·梅尔茨表示，如果欧盟碳市场无法推动工业向清洁生产转型，欧盟就应考虑修改或推迟该市场。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the European Union should be open to revising or postponing its carbon market if it doesn’t enable the industry shift to clean production.】

item.title: 特朗普如何摧毁气候法规的法律根基
item.description: 2009年，美国环境保护署正式认定温室气体危害公众健康与福祉。这项所谓"危害认定"成为一系列遏制全球变暖污染法规的法律基础——同时也成为保守派势力试图推翻这些法规的长期目标。【原文：In 2009, the Environmental Protection Agency formally concluded that greenhouse gases jeopardize public health and welfare. This so-called endangerment finding became the legal foundation for a host of rules combating planet-warming pollution — and a perennial target of conservative efforts to reverse them.】

item.title: 巴克莱警告能源转型风险相关成本不断攀升
item.description: 巴克莱银行指出，主要经济体在能源转型方面的巨大分歧，可能迫使银行在增长与气候融资之间做出选择。【原文：The deep divide in how major economies are approaching the energy transition risks forcing banks to choose between growth and climate finance, according to Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 采用激光技术的核聚变初创公司融资4.5亿美元
item.description: 此外，气候变化如何助长了阿根廷和智利的野火。【原文：Also, how climate change fueled the wildfires in Argentina and Chile.】

item.title: 特朗普政府将就海上风电场裁决提起上诉
item.description: 内政部长道格·伯格姆表示，特朗普政府计划就一系列阻止海上风电场建设努力的法院裁决提起上诉。【原文：The Trump administration plans to appeal a series of court rulings blocking efforts to stop construction of offshore wind farms, Interior Secretary Doug Burgum said.】

item.title: 英国数百个清洁能源项目面临电网接入新延迟
item.description: 英国电网运营商将重置多达210个风能、太阳能及电池项目的进度表，承认无法满足被视为政府2030年清洁能源目标关键节点的时间要求。【原文：Britain’s grid operator will reset the timetable for as many as 210 wind, solar and battery projects, conceding it cannot meet deadlines seen as critical for the government’s 2030 clean power target.】

item.title: 聚变初创企业筹集4.5亿美元，计划利用全球最大激光装置发电
item.description:
惯性企业公司采用的融合技术是目前唯一在实验室环境中被证实能够产生净能量的技术。【原文：

Inertia Enterprises relies on the only fusion technology proven to generate net power in a lab.

】

item.title: 埃克萨罗将审议提高股息，同时实现业务多元化以摆脱煤炭依赖
item.description: 南非煤炭企业埃克萨罗资源有限公司近期通过收购锰矿资产实现业务多元化，此后将优先推进旨在提高投资者分红的审查工作。【原文：South African coal miner Exxaro Resources Ltd. will prioritize a review aimed at boosting investor dividends following its recent move to diversify from coal by adding manganese assets.】

item.title: 气候变化与预算削减助长南美山火
item.description:
一项新研究发现，降雨减少和松树种植园的增加正加剧野火发生的风险。

【原文：

A new study found that less rain and pine tree plantations are increasing the likelihood of wildfires.

】

item.title: 报告称银行支持绿色钢铁基金实为"虚假解决方案"
item.description: 几乎所有承诺为低碳钢铁提供融资的主要银行，都在支持将导致额外温室气体污染的举措。【原文：Almost all major banks that have pledged to finance low-carbon steel are backing initiatives that will lead to additional greenhouse gas pollution.】

item.title: “雾霾季”折扣再殃印度企业盈利
item.description: 印度空气污染不仅危害公众健康，还给企业利润带来新的威胁。在最近的财报季中，多家公司都提到了污染导致的运营中断所造成的影响。【原文：India’s air pollution is adding another threat to company profits along with impacts on public health, with a sweep of companies pointing to the effects of pollution-related disruptions in the country’s most recent earnings season.】

item.title: 特朗普将指示五角大楼采购燃煤电力以振兴煤炭产业
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普将公布一项计划，拟动用政府资金和五角大楼合同来维持美国燃煤电厂的运营，以推动国内对化石燃料的依赖。【原文：President Donald Trump will unveil plans to use government funding and Pentagon contracts to sustain US coal-fired power plants as he seeks to drive domestic reliance on the fossil fuel.】

item.title: 绿色债务置换市场曾一度火爆，如今却在降温。
item.description: 新兴市场债券正日益具有吸引力。【原文：Emerging market bonds are increasingly attractive.】

item.title: 银行家推销新兴市场债务置换方案，在曾经火爆的市场遭遇阻力
item.description: 在规模虽小但利润丰厚的债务互换市场中，银行家们如今正努力完成交易。【原文：Bankers in the small but lucrative market for debt swaps are now struggling to complete deals.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚称欧盟甲烷法规将使炼油商石油成本增加13%
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司在本周欧盟领导人会议前警告称，欧盟旨在遏制强效温室气体甲烷排放的法规，可能使原油进口成本增加约13%，并对欧盟工业基础造成重创。【原文：European Union rules intended to curb emissions of methane, a potent greenhouse gas, could add about 13% to the cost of crude oil imports and deal a hammer blow to the bloc’s industrial base, Exxon Mobil Corp. warned ahead of a meeting of leaders this week.】
